course.subject: OCES
course.name: Survey of Ocean Science
course.description: The ocean defines the features of our planet. The ultimate goal of the course is to promote and enhance ocean literacy, which means the awareness and understanding of fundamental concepts of the history, functioning, and utilization of the ocean. By the end of this course students will understand the ocean's influence on individuals and their influence on the ocean. The course will cover a wide range of topics including ocean physics, marine chemistry, marine geology, and biological oceanography.

reviews.author: SST
reviews.comment_content:
[ZOOM teaching]
Covered ocean physics, marine chemistry and geochemistry, geology and geophysics, biological oceanography, ocean resource, and environmental concern.
Lecture
1. Ocean as a Key Component of Earth System
2. Ocean exploration
3. Origins
4. Earth structure
5. seafloor
6. sediment
7-8. Wind-Driven Circulations
9-11. Stratified Ocean Circulation
11-12. Ocean Turbulence and Climate
12. Air-Sea Interaction: El Ni˜no and La Ni˜na
13. Chemical Properties of Seawater
14. Nutrient cycles and energy flow
15. Introduction to marine ecology
16. Phytoplankton and primary production
17. Zooplankton food web
18. Biological pump and Iron limitation
19. Fisheries
(20. Don't know why this is missing)
21. Coastal processes and ecosystem
22. Marine resources and development
23. Ocean health and human impacts
24. Climate change and the ocean

Officially no attendance required.
Prof. WYATT would have polls on zoom during lessons.
Some topics are only common sense.
Quite interesting if you like oceans.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. LIU is quite boring, luckily the lesson wasn't start at 9. But I usually not listening to him and his lectures (mainly about geology and biology) can be understood by reading lecture notes.

Prof. WANG is one of the best professor I have met in HKUST. His lectures mainly about physics (L7-12). He is patient to explain the concepts and answer students' questions. Students are more active in his lessons rather than that of other professors.

Prof. WYATT. Not much to say about his teaching, he is responsible for the chemistry and resources part. He would raise polls during lessons. His lecture notes uploaded on canvas are not full version (some words/ pictures are covered), you may ask for full version by emailing him but he is quite strict in the attendance stuff.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework assignments 30%
Final exam 70%

3 Homework assignments(one long questions that contains 3-4 parts) assigned by each professor. Not a difficult one but it only covers 30% of the final grade, there are always students getting full marks.
Final is a take home exam which have 48 hours for you to finish it. There are 7 long questions.

Assignment 1: mean: 4.4/5  high:5/5
Assignment 2: mean: 4.1/5  high:5/5
Assignment 3: mean: 3.7/5  high:5/5
Final take home exam: mean: 49.6/70  high: 66/70

The grading is not good not bad (?)
My assignments: 4.5/5 ; 5/5 ; 4.5/5
Final take home exam: 52/70
Final Grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
3 Assignment and 1 Final take home exam(48hours).
Light workload for the assignments but the take home exam held during final period and is a disaster for me especially I got another 2 finals within that 48 hours. The final exam requires citation as well.

Overall: Not a heavy workload course if you have a good final schedule.

reviews.author: Ssskkkhkukst
reviews.title: OCES 2001
reviews.comment_content:
1 topic per lecture:
Ocean Exploration
Earth history, Origin of Life
Earth structure and Plate tectonic
Ocean basin and sea floor
Ocean sediments
Wind, pressure, and Earth’s rotation
Ocean gyres and boundary currents
Buoyancy fluxes and seawater properties
Global overturning circulation
Gravity waves and ocean mixing
Mesoscale eddies and climate prediction
Ocean chemistry I: Chemical properties of seawater
Ocean chemistry II: Nutrient cycles and energy flow
Phytoplankton and primary production
Phytoplankton and primary production
Zooplankton and Microbial food web
Biological pump and iron limitation hypothesis
Fisheries oceanography
Benthic ecology
Deep-sea ecology
Marine resources and development
Ocean health and human impacts
Climate change and the ocean
reviews.comment_teaching:
Hongbin LIU teaching is very chill, pacing is good, and his english is simple, so no stress and no hard work to pay attention
WANG and WYATT covered few lectures only
reviews.comment_grading:
40% midterm exam
55% final exam
5% attendance

the exam is easy, but some questions are not in the ppt
WYATT will reuse his iPRS questions in the exam
reviews.comment_workload:
Hongbin LIU didnt taken any attendance, but will have one short pop-up quiz
Yan WANG will not take attendance
Alex WYATT will use iPRS to record class participation

No hw
